post.description:
**Public Endpoint**
- Verifies the validity of a JWT token
- Checks token signature, expiration, and claims
- Returns confirmation with user information if token is valid
- Used for token validation in external services

Valid Token Response.value: Token is valid for user: user@example.com

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid or missing Authorization header

get.description:
**ðŸ”’ Authentication Required**
Retrieves a paginated list of users, sorted by username in descending order.
Supports filtering by a search term (matching email, username, first name, or last name)
and by multiple user roles and statuses. The response includes user details such as
first name, last name, email, role, and status.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Number of users per page (default: 100, max: 100)

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Search term to filter users by email, username, first name, or last name (case-insensitive)

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: Filter users by one or more roles (e.g., VIEWER, ADMIN, EDITOR, MANAGER)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter users by one or more statuses (e.g., ACTIVE, PENDING, DEACTIVATED)

200.description: Successfully retrieved paginated list of users

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid pagination parameters or role value

403.description: Forbidden - Insufficient permissions to access this resource

value.message: You do not have permission to access this resource

500.description: Internal Server Error - Unexpected error occurred

value.title: Internal Server Error
value.detail: An unexpected error occurred while processing the request

post.description:
**ðŸ”’ Authentication Required**
- Creates a new user with the specified details and assigns them to the provided journey IDs
- Journey IDs must be valid UUID strings (e.g., "28c5edda-8213-4500-ae2a-228539fc72cc")
- Returns a success message upon creation
- Roles must be one of: VIEWER, EDITOR, ADMIN

schema.description: Request body for creating a new user

value.title: Bad Request

value.detail: Invalid UUID format for journeyId: invalid-uuid

value.title: Conflict
value.detail: User with email john.doe@example.com already exists

Uploads a single file and returns its accessible URL.

Supported file types:

- Videos: MP4 (max 25MB)

post.description:
**ðŸ”’ Authorization Required**
- Requires valid authentication credentials
- User must have **ADMIN** or **EDITOR** role

Generates a presigned URL for accessing an S3 asset in the migration bucket.
The presigned URL provides temporary access to the specified object without requiring AWS credentials.

**Note:** This endpoint is specifically for S3 migration bucket access.

You do not have permission to access this resource

post.description:
**ðŸ”’ Authentication & Authorization Required**
- User must have **VIEWER** role
- Allows users to provide feedback after completing a stage

**Business Rules:**
- Stage must be completed before feedback can be submitted
- Each user can only submit feedback once per stage
- Feedback can be either:
  - **Submitted**: Requires rating (1-5), optional text feedback
  - **Skipped**: No rating or text required, just marks as skipped

**Validation:**
- Rating: Must be between 1-5 (when not skipped)
- Feedback text: Optional, max 250 characters
- Cannot provide rating when skipping
- Must provide rating when not skipping

**Response Messages:**
- "Feedback submitted successfully" (when skipped=false)
- "Feedback skipped successfully" (when skipped=true)

Submit Feedback with Rating and Text.description: User provides rating and optional feedback text

value.feedbackText: Excellent onboarding experience! Very clear and helpful.

Submit Feedback with Rating Only.description: User provides only a rating without text

Skip Feedback.description: User chooses to skip providing feedback

value.feedbackText: Needs improvement. Too long and repetitive.

Feedback Submitted.description: User successfully submitted feedback with rating

value.message: Feedback submitted successfully
Feedback skipped successfully

400.description: Bad Request - Validation errors or business rule violations

Stage Not Completed.description: User tried to submit feedback for an incomplete stage

value.title: Bad Request
value.detail: Cannot submit feedback for incomplete stage

Feedback Already Submitted.description: User has already submitted feedback for this stage

value.title: Bad Request
value.detail: Feedback already submitted for this stage

errors: rating: Rating must be between 1 and 5

Rating Required When Not Skipped.description: Rating is required when skipped is false

value.title: Bad Request
value.detail: Rating is required when feedback is not skipped

Rating Not Allowed When Skipped.description: Rating should not be provided when skipping

value.title: Bad Request
value.detail: Rating should not be provided when skipping feedback

errors: feedbackText: Feedback text cannot exceed 250 characters

value.title: Unauthorized
value.detail: Full authentication is required to access this resource

403.description: Forbidden - User does not have VIEWER role

value.title: Forbidden
value.detail: Access denied. Only users with VIEWER role can submit feedback.

404.description: Not Found - Stage with given ID does not exist

- If page is not favourite, it will be added to favourites

post.description:
**ðŸ”’ Authentication Required**
- Requires valid authentication credentials
- User must have **ADMIN** role

Performs bulk data migration based on the provided migration request.
This operation allows for custom migration scenarios with configurable
data sources and transformation rules.

**Note:** This is a background operation that may take considerable time
depending on the amount of data being migrated.

value.message: Migration started in the background

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid migration request or validation errors

value.title: Unprocessable Entity
value.detail: Invalid migration configuration: unsupported source type

500.description: Internal Server Error - Migration processing failed

value.title: Internal Server Error
value.detail: Migration processing failed due to internal error

post.description:
**ðŸ”’ Authentication Required**
- Requires valid authentication credentials
- User must have **ADMIN** role

Migrates course text content from legacy JSON file stored in the classpath.
This operation processes the predefined course_text_gb.json file and imports
the content into the current system structure.

**Note:** This is a background operation that may take several minutes to complete.

value.message: Migration started in the background

422.description: Unprocessable Entity - Migration file not found or invalid

value.title: Unprocessable Entity
value.detail: JSON file not found in classpath: appical/course_text_gb.json

500.description: Internal Server Error - Migration processing failed

value.title: Internal Server Error
value.detail: Failed to process JSON file from classpath

get.summary: Get all journeys assigned to an editor
get.description:
**ðŸ”’ Authorization & Permissions Required**
- Requires valid authentication credentials
- User must have **VIEWER**, **EDITOR**, or **ADMIN** role

Retrieves a paginated list of journeys assigned to the current user.
Supports filtering by title (case-insensitive) and status (case-insensitive,
e.g., 'live', 'draft', 'archived'). If no status is provided, all statuses are returned.
Admin users can retrieve all journeys, while non-admin users only see journeys they are assigned to.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Optional search term to filter journeys by title (case-insensitive)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Optional status to filter journeys (case-insensitive: 'live', 'draft', 'archived'). If omitted, all statuses are included.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid status value provided

value.message: Invalid status value: invalid
You do not have permission to access this resource
Journey 'Alpine Adventure Expedition' created successfully

**ðŸ”’ Authentication & Authorization Required**
- User must have **VIEWER** role
- Checks if the authenticated user has already provided feedback for a specific stage

**Use Cases:**
- Determine whether to show feedback prompt to user
- Check if user has already completed or skipped feedback
- Used by frontend to conditionally render feedback forms

**Response:**
- `hasCompletedFeedback`: `true` if user has submitted or skipped feedback, `false` otherwise

parameters.name: stageId
parameters.description: The Storyblok ID of the stage to check feedback status for

No Feedback Yet.description: User has not provided any feedback for this stage

Feedback Already Provided.description: User has already submitted or skipped feedback
